availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry J. Sheets (Franklin County, Kentucky blacksmith and soldier)

body.p: Franklin County, Kentucky, blacksmith and soldier. Franklin County, Kentucky, native. Son of John Sheets and Elizabeth Sheets. Married Martha A. Martin in Woodford County, Kentucky, on December 21, 1854. Father of John C. Sheets, Ida J. Sheets, Ann E. Sheets, James B. Sheets, and Millie Sheets. Farmer in Franklin County in 1850. Blacksmith in Frankfort in 1860. Served in the Frankfort Union Guards (U.S.A.) as a first sergeant from July 11, 1862 to August 1, 1862. Served in the 9th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a first lieutenant and captain from August 22, 1862 to August 21, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 2, p. 73B
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, District 1, p. 258.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Illinois, Richland, Olney Ward 2, p. 610A.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 398.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994058, Woodford County Marriages, p. 467.
"Henry J. Sheets (1831-1882)," Find A Grave, Memorial 35455392, accessed February 9, 2019, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/35455392.
